page.title: 06Deer of Cannock Chase.
page.content: There are 3 kinds of deer on the Chase, Red deer, Muntjac and Fallow deer.{The Fallow deer} are commonest, numbering about 300 in all. They are the most adaptable species and are able to thrive where other species cannot. Several{deer lawns} have been established on the Chase and deer may often be spotted near them. Deer can be a nuisance sometimes, because they eat farmers' crops and go into gardens and do damage. They also eat tree shoots and foresters have to protect the young trees. The rutting season, when the bucks may be heard calling, is in October. Fawns are born in June. At this time people must be especially careful about keeping their dogs on leads. A small {Deer Museum} is situated at {Ladyhill near Rugeley.}
